org.gearman

Interface GearmanFunctionCallback


  • public interface GearmanFunctionCallback
    The interface used by the GearmanFunction to send data back to the client mid-process.
    Author:
    isaiah

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] getJobHandle()
      Returns the job handle for the job currently being executed.
      boolean isAlive()
      Indicated if the job is still alive.
      void sendData(byte[] data)
      The data callback channel.

      When the GearmanFunction receives a GearmanJob, this method can used to send information to the client while the job is executing

      Client Side: Override this method to define how information received on this callback channel should be handled.
      void sendStatus(long numerator, long denominator)
      Updates the client of the job progress.

      When the GearmanFunction receives a GearmanJob, this method can used to send information about the jobs progress back to the client.

      Client Side: Override this method to define how information received on this callback channel should be handled.
      void sendWarning(byte[] warning)
      The warning callback channel.

    • Method Detail

      • sendWarning

        void sendWarning(byte[] warning)
        The warning callback channel. This is just like the data callback channel, but its purpose is to send warning information.

        When the GearmanFunction receives a GearmanJob, this method can used to send information to the client while the job is executing

        Client Side: Override this method to define how information received on this callback channel should be handled. If this method is not overwritten, the information will be dropped.

        Worker Side: This method will throw a IllegalStateException if the job has completed. Only while the job is executing can the callback methods be used.
        Parameters:
        warning - Information to send on the data callback channel

      • sendData

        void sendData(byte[] data)
        The data callback channel.

        When the GearmanFunction receives a GearmanJob, this method can used to send information to the client while the job is executing

        Client Side: Override this method to define how information received on this callback channel should be handled. If this method is not overwritten, the information will be dropped.

        Worker Side: This method will throw a IllegalStateException if the job has completed. Only while the job is executing can the callback methods be used.
        Parameters:
        data - Information to send on the data callback channel

      • sendStatus

        void sendStatus(long numerator,
              long denominator)
        Updates the client of the job progress.

        When the GearmanFunction receives a GearmanJob, this method can used to send information about the jobs progress back to the client.

        Client Side: Override this method to define how information received on this callback channel should be handled. If this method is not overwritten, the information will be dropped.

        Worker Side: This method will throw a IllegalStateException if the job has completed. Only while the job is executing can the callback methods be used.
        Parameters:
        numerator - A number typically specifying the numerator in the fraction work that's completed
        denominator - A number typically specifying the denominator in the fraction work that's completed

      • getJobHandle

        byte[] getJobHandle()
        Returns the job handle for the job currently being executed.
        Returns:
        The job handle

      • isAlive

        boolean isAlive()
        Indicated if the job is still alive. If the job is not alive, information will not be sent back to the server. This includes returning the result and calls to sendData(byte[]), sendWarning(byte[]), and sendStatus(long, long).

        A job will die if one of the following events occur:
        1) The job has already been completed.
        2) The worker disconnected from the server while working on the job.
        Returns:
        true is the job is alive.
